    Meet the research groups

    Who we are

    Posted on June 16, 2024

    The core of EpiCoN currently includes seven research groups from the Departments of Molecular Biology, Medical Biosciences, Physics, and Medical and Translational Biology.

    Francesca Aguilo

    Francesca works on RNA modifications and RNA-based gene regulation of cell fate and breast cancer.
    [group site]

    Jan Larsson

    Jan studies aneuploidies, chromosome-wide gene regulation and chromosome segregation.
    [group site]

    Sofie Degerman

    Sofie is interested in developing DNA methylation as a tool to personalize the treatment of childhood leukemia.
    [group site]

    Andreas Hörnblad

    Andreas works on gene regulatory mechanisms in obesity-associated liver cancer and development. He is epicon's chair during 2024.
    [group site]

    Yuri Schwartz

    Yuri studies molecular mechanisms of epigenetic regulation by the Polycomb and Trithorax proteins.
    [group site]

    Silvia Remeseiro

    Silvia works on 3D genome organization, chromatin Biology and long-range interactions in cancer.
    [group site]

    Ludvig Lizana

    Ludvig uses theoretical methods from physics to model chromatin folding, epigenetic regulation and mammalian aging. He is epicon's vice chair during 2024.
    [group site]
